ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I strengthened my grammar, writing, and listening skills.
Knowledge of grammar forms, vocabulary, and culture
Gained better skill in understanding, speaking, and writing in Italian.
Continued the skills of L1 and L2 Italian.  We learned about present, past, conditional and future tenses.  We also continued partitives.  Practiced speaking the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There was an extremely positive and open learning environment that encouraged me to try my best and not worry about making mistakes. Michael explains difficult concepts very well. The course could be improved by requiring more/different speaking engagements. I feel like my speaking skills are not as developed as others.

Strengths- Michael Farina! He is an amazing professor and makes the course incredibly engaging 

Weaknesses- none
Professor Farina is a very fun and supportive professor. Content helped reinforce my knowledge of Italian. I enjoyed class discussions on readings and short videos. Tests were very fair.
Strengths; Professor Farina is excellent! I may have not been the best at the language but you can tell he really cared about effort into the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Wonderful experience with 130. Made me want to take 140 even though I haven't planned on it. Wish Farina was teaching a section of 140.
Yes. I enjoyed coming to class every day because I knew I was stepping into a positive learning environment.
Yes, definitely take this course with Michael- it is incredibly rewarding
Yes! Really fun and informative class.

Take the class with Professor Farina! Other professors in the department can be very harsh and intimidating but Farina recognizes that languages might not be everyones strength but he cares about the effort you put in.  Basically you get what you put into this course and I couldnt imagine L3 with another professor.  There are daily quizzes and I wasnt sure how much they were worth but they kept you on top of the class.
